questions.text: What is the minimum age beyond which sex determination based on skeleton would be highly accurate?
questions.solution:
Explanation:

  • The minimum age for highly accurate sex determination from skeletal remains is 14-16 years, as significant skeletal changes reflecting sexual dimorphism (e.g., pelvic shape, bone robusticity) become pronounced during puberty.
  • In prepubertal skeletons, sex allocation accuracy is about 50%, increasing to 80% with the pelvis by 14-16 years.

questions.text:
A pelvis is brought for forensic examination. Which of the following characteristics will identify the given pelvis as male?
1. Triangular obturator foramen
2. U-shaped pubic angle
3. Everted ischial tuberosity
4. Broad greater sciatic notch
5. Large acetabulum
6. Deep preauricular sulcus
questions.solution:
Explanation:

  • Among the given options, a large acetabulum (only 5) is characteristic of a male pelvis.
  • Triangular obturator foramen, V-shaped pubic angle, everted ischial tuberosity, large greater sciatic notch, and deep preauricular sulcus are characteristics of a female pelvis.

questions.text: Characteristic features of the frontal and parietal eminences in the female skull are:
questions.solution:
Explanation:

In the female skull, both frontal and parietal eminences are larger.

questions.text: You have measured the femur length to be 40cm from the skeletal remains of an unknown person. What is the approximate height of the individual?
questions.solution:
Explanation:

The stature/femur relationship is 3.74. Thus, stature can be calculated by using the formula, stature = femur length x 3.74 = 40 x 3.74 = 149.6 cm = 150 cm

Methods of Determination of Stature:

  1. Pearson's Formula:
    • Pearson's method estimates stature using long bone measurements.
    • The bones used, in descending order of reliability, are: Femur > Tibia > Humerus > Radius
  2. Trotter & Gleser Method:
    • Stature = 1.30 × (Femur + Tibia) + 63.29
  3. Stature-to-Femur Length Ratio:
    • Stature ≈ 3.74 × Femur length
  4. Anatomical Method:
    • This method involves summing the lengths of multiple skeletal elements: skull, spine (vertebral column), femur, tibia, and foot bones.
    • A soft tissue correction is added to account for non-bony components.

questions.text: The Crown Rump Length is 21 cm, the length of the lower limb is 10 cm, the gestational age of the foetus will be:
questions.solution:
Explanation:

The gestational age of this foetus is 6-7 months.

  • Crown-rump length + Length of lower limb = Crown heel length
  • The rule of Haase and Morrison's rule enables the estimation of the gestational age of the foetus in lunar months from its crown-heel length (in cm).
  • According to the Rule of Haase, if the crown-heel length is less than 25 cm, Age in lunar months = Square root of crown-heel length
  • According to Morrison's rule, if the crown-heel length is more than 25 cm, Age in lunar months = crown-heel length divided by 5.

Here, crown heel length = Crown-rump + lower limb length = 31 cm.

Hence, gestational age = 31 / 5 = 6-7 months.

questions.text: A victim of child trafficking was brought to you by the police for age determination. Which of the following would you use as an accurate method for determining the same?
questions.solution:
Explanation:

  • From the given options, mineralization of teethis the more accurate method of age determination in childhood.
  • The relationship between chronological age and dental age is stronger than between chronological age and skeletal age.

Two aspects of tooth development have been used in the estimation of dental age:

  • The emergence of teeth - the superior part of the crown of the tooth appearing level with the surface of the alveolar bone
  • The stage of mineralization of crowns and roots during development

questions.text: Which of the following is the earliest tooth to erupt in a 7-month-old baby?
questions.solution:
Explanation:

The earliest tooth to erupt in a 7-month-old baby (primary dentition) is a mandibular central incisor.

questions.text: Electron microscopy of the surface of tooth enamel revealed a neonatal line. What is your inference?
questions.solution:
Explanation:

  • Neonatal line is an incremental line found on the surface of tooth enamel, that indicates that an infant waslive born.
  • The study of dental microstructure, which involves counting perikymata(incremental lines on the surface of tooth enamel), can provide an accurate method of age determination.
  • One particularly pronounced incremental line, the neonatal line,can be of medicolegal significance in determining whether an infant was live-born or stillborn. It is formed very soon after birth and can be visualized by light microscopy if the child survived for about 3 weeks or by electron microscopy within 1 or 2 days of birth.

questions.text: Which of the following is the most reliable criterion for age determination from Gustafson's method?
questions.solution:
Explanation:

Transparency of the root is the most reliable criterion.

  • Gustafson's method of estimating of age of an individual is based on physiological changes in teeth. It is mainly useful in adults over 25 years of age.

Gustafson criteria include: (Mnemonic: SCRIPT)

  1. Secondary dentin formation - Deposition of dentin in pulp cavity
  2. Cementum apposition - Deposition of cementum in the root forming incremental lines
  3. Root resorption - Involves both cementum and dentin
  4. Attrition - Wear and tear changes of the occlusal surface
  5. Periodontosis - Regression of gums surrounding the tooth resulting in loosening of the tooth and falling
  6. Transparency of the root - This is the most reliable criterion. Canals in dentin get filled with minerals and they become less transparent.

Reference:

https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Rakesh-Gorea/publication/236608227_Age_estimation_by_Gustafson_method_and_its_modifications/links/57d1798e08ae6399a38b5499/Age-estimation-by-Gustafson-method-and-its-modifications.pdf

questions.text: A 10-year-old child is brought to the dental OPD for routine examination. The dentist documents the dental findings using the chart shown below. Which dental notation method is being used by the dentist?
questions.solution:
Explanation:

  • Palmer's notation is used for charting teeth.
  • Permanent teeth are denoted by numbers from 1 to 8 starting from the central incisor till the third molar in each quadrant.
  • Temporary teeth are denoted by English alphabets (Capital Letters) from 'A' to 'E' from the central incisor till the second molar in each quadrant.
  • The numbers and alphabets are written within the shape of the quadrant as shown below.


Explanation of incorrect answer:

FDI system (Option A) uses a two-digit format, where the first digit indicates the quadrant (1 to 4 for permanent teeth and 5 to 8 for deciduous teeth) and the second digit indicates the tooth type (1 through 8 or 1 through 5). However, the chart shown in the question uses quadrant brackets and single-digit numbers, not two-digit numerical codes like 11, 21, or 55.


Universal numbering system (Option C) involves the use of Arabic numerals 1 to 32 for permanent teeth and letters A to T for deciduous teeth, arranged in a clockwise sequence. This system emphasizes reducing errors by assigning a unique number or letter to each tooth. Since the chart in question does not use a continuous numbering system or the alphabet, it does not follow the Universal method.


Haderup system (Option D) uses plus (+) and minus (-) signs to denote upper and lower jaws, respectively. For primary teeth, it uses a zero prefix, and the sign position indicates the right or left quadrant. Because the chart in question does not include plus/minus signs or zero prefixes, it does not match the Haderup system.


Reference: https://static.tecnichenuove.it/ejpd/pdf/EJPD_2015_2_15.pdf

questions.text: You receive a dental report from an autopsy of a homicide case, stating that FDI notation tooth number '43' is missing. Which tooth is missing in the victim?
questions.solution:
Explanation:

  • In FDI notation 43, the number 4 indicates the lower right quadrant and the number 3 indicates the canine tooth. Hence 43 indicates the lower right canine.
  • FDI (Federation Dentaire Internationale) represents a number assigned to each quadrant and that number is placed before the tooth's number.
  • FDI (Federation Dentaire Internationale) System:
  • Two-digit system.
  • The first digit indicates the quadrant:
    • 1 to 4 for permanent teeth (1 = upper right, 2 = upper left, 3 = lower left, 4 = lower right)
    • 5 to 8 for deciduous (primary) teeth (5 = upper right, 6 = upper left, 7 = lower left, 8 = lower right)
  • The second digit indicates the tooth position from the midline:
    • 1 to 8 for permanent teeth (1 = central incisor, 8 = third molar)
    • 1 to 5 for deciduous teeth (1 = central incisor, 5 = second molar)

Universal Numbering System:

  • Uses Arabic numbers (1-32) for permanent teeth.
  • Uses letters (A-T) for deciduous teeth.
  • Numbering proceeds clockwise around the dentition.
  • Reduces the risk of mistakes due to specific numbers per tooth.

Haderup System:

  • For primary teeth, a zero is prefixed to the numeral.
  • Plus sign (+): Upper quadrants.
  • Minus sign (-): Lower quadrants.
  • Sign on right: Right side; sign on left: Left side.

Reference:

https://static.tecnichenuove.it/ejpd/pdf/EJPD_2015_2_15.pdf

questions.text: Match the following sutures with their correct age at the beginning of fusion.
questions.solution:
Explanation:

The correct answer is 1-b, 2-d, 3-a, 4-c.

Fusion of distal end of ulna
Fusion of distal end of knee
Fusion of proximal end of humerus

questions.text: Which among the following is the best indicator that a person's age is 16 years or more?
questions.solution:
Explanation:

The complete union of the proximal radius and ulna and the distal end of the humerus is considered a conclusive evidence of age 16 years or more.

The following picture shows the fusion of ossification centres at various joints:

questions.text: The most accurate estimation of age can be done in the 3rd decade to the 5th decade?
questions.solution:
Explanation:

  • Estimation of age in adulthood between 20 to 50 years (3rdto 5th decade) is best estimated by degenerative changes in the pubic symphysis.
  • Physical anthropology has established several methods for determining age in adults which include macroscopic, microscopic, andbiomolecular methods.
  • Macroscopic methods of adult age determination are the most important ones and consist principally in the degree of degeneration of selected articulations such as:
    • Pubic symphysis
    • Osteochondral surface of the 4thrib
    • Auricular surface of the ilium

questions.text: The ossification centres that appear before birth include all the following except:
questions.solution:
Explanation:

The ossification centre for the Head of the humerus does not appear before birth. It appears at ½ to 1 year of age.

Ossification centres which are already present when an infant is born include:

  • Calcaneus (5thmonth) (Option D)
  • Talus (7thmonth)
  • Cuboid (9thmonth)
  • The distal end of the femur (9thmonth) (Option A)
  • The proximal end of the tibia (At birth) (Option B)
  • Sternum - Manubrium & first piece of body (5thmonth), 2nd & 3rd piece of body (7th month) and 4th piece of body (10th month)

questions.text: The maximum age of the person, as determined by the analysis of carpal bones in this X-ray, is.
questions.solution:
• The X-ray shows all carpal bones except the pisiform, which appears at 9-12 years.
  • Scaphoid, trapezium, and trapezoid (appearing at 4-5 years) are present, indicating an age between 4 and 12 years.
  • The maximum age, based on the absence of pisiform, is approximately 12 years, but the closest option is 10 years.

Reference:

Textbook of Forensic Medicine & Toxicology, Anil Aggrawal, 2nd Edition, Page Number: 83

questions.text: Estimate the age from the given X-ray?
questions.solution:
Explanation:

  • In the X-ray image of the wrist, all the carpal bones have appeared. The last carpal bone to appear is the pisiform, which appears between 9 and 12 years. So, the age is more than 9 years. In the same image, the lower ends of the radius and ulna have fused, which fuses at the age of 19 years. So, the age is more than 19 years.
  • In the second image, the upper ends of the radius & ulna and the lower end of the humerus have fused, which fuses at the age of 16 years. So, the age is more than 16 years.

It requires an antemortem picture of the victim

questions.text: Which among the following statements regarding photo superimposition is false?
questions.solution:
Explanation:

  • Photo Superimpositionis only performed on the skull, not the pelvis.
  • Photo Superimposition is a well-established technique used for identification. It is done when a potential candidate for the identity of the skull is known to the investigating authority and photographs taken during life are available. (Option C)
  • Photographs of the skull are taken in the same orientation in 3 planes as the available photograph. These are then enlarged to the same dimensions as the photograph, and either the negative or a positive print is made on transparent film. (Option D)
  • The test is mainly an exclusionary onee. if the match cannot be made, then the skull is not that of the person in the photograph. If the match is good or excellent, then it may or may not be the same person. (Option B)

questions.text: The dental formula for milk (deciduous) teeth is 2 1 0 2. Based on this formula, what is the total number of milk teeth in a child?
questions.solution:
Explanation:

The dental formula 2 1 0 2 represents:

  • 2 incisors, 1 canine, 0 premolars, and 2 molars in one half of the upper or lower jaw.
  • Since humans are bilaterally symmetrical, multiply by 4 (i.e., both left and right, upper and lower sides): (2+1+0+2) ×4 =5×4 =20

Hence, the total number of milk teeth = 20.

  • For comparison, the adult dental formula is 2 1 2 3, which gives: (2+1+2+3)×4 =8×4 =32 permanent teeth
